Revaluation_Run_Group_SelectionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Revaluation_Run_Group_SelectionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Revaluation_Run_Group_SelectionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Revaluation_Run_Data.description: Supply a combination of Revaluation Groups and/or Revaluation Rules via this field.

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Revaluation_Run_Data.description: Organization that the revaluation run is created for; this can include hierarchies.

Fiscal_YearObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
For types that require a parent reference, contains a unique identifier for an instance of a parent object.
For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Fiscal_YearObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Fiscal_Posting_IntervalObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Fiscal_Posting_IntervalObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Revaluation_Run_Data.description: Fiscal Year and Fiscal Posting Interval to derive the Fiscal Period for which you want to run the revaluation.

validation.validation: The Fiscal Year and Fiscal Posting Interval must be for the same Fiscal Schedule.

Revaluation_Run_Data.description: Revaluation Reversal Date used by revaluation run when the revaluation rule indicates to create a reversal.

description: Element used for starting a revaluation run.

validation.validation: The selected Company or a Company within a selected Company Hierarchy do not share the same Account Set and cannot be processed together.
The selected Company or a Company within a selected Company Hierarchy does not have an Account Set defined.
The selected Company or a Company within a selected Company Hierarchy do not share the same Fiscal Schedule and cannot be processed together.
The revaluation rules for the selected companies use common companies, book code, and ledger accounts: [revaluation rules].
Reversal Date must be empty for the selected Revaluation Rule or Group.
The selected Company or Company Hierarchy is invalid for the specified Revaluation Rule or Revaluation Group.
You cannot submit Inactive Groups or Rules: [inactive_groups_and_or_rules]
The Revaluation Reversal Date must be within the [reversing period] fiscal period.
The Reversal Period is not open for the selected companies. You must open the reversal period before you can process revaluation.
The Fiscal Period is not open for the selected companies. You must open the fiscal period before you can process revaluation.
The Fiscal Period or Reversal Period is not open for one or more companies. You must open the closed periods before you can process revaluation.
